abstract: J C X Simon, one of four men convicted in series of racially-motivated attacks in mid-1970s San Francisco that killed 14 people and injured seven, is found dead in his California prison cell; cause of death is under investigation.
lead_paragraph: J. C. X. Simon, 69, was one of four black men convicted in a six-month series of murders that targeted white victims in San Francisco.

headline.main: Convict in ’70s ‘Zebra’ Killings Is Found Dead in Prison Cell
headline.print_headline: Convict in ’70s ‘Zebra’ Killings Is Found Dead in Prison Cell

snippet: J. C. X. Simon, 69, was one of four black men convicted in a six-month series of murders that targeted white victims in San Francisco.
